p: So when resistance became a major problem organophosphorous larvicides, particularly temephos (Abate), were adopted. Alternatives to temephos are methoprene, a synthetic compound that interferes with insect metamorphosis, and bti, a mosquito-specific, gut-toxic protein suspension derived from the bacterium Bacillus thuringiensis serotype H-14. Numerous larvicidal plant extracts have been identified in the laboratory ( Giatropoulos et al., 2012, Kovendan et al., 2012, Kovendan et al., 2013, Mahesh Kumar et al., 2013).
